info.title: TAPCLICKS
info.description:
This is the first version of the API Specification for TapClicks. # AUTHENTICATION The **TapClicks** API uses the OAuth 2.0 protocol for authentication and authorization (Client Credentials Grant).
All requests must be authenticated and must include a valid access token.

tags.name: POSSIBLE RESPONSES
tags.description:
**Possible Response Codes:**
```
> 200 - OK: The request was successful and the response body contains 
            the representation requested
> 302 - FOUND: A common redirect response; you can GET the representation 
            at the URL in the Location response header
> 304 - NOT MODIFIED: Your client's cached version of the representation 
            is still up to date
> 400 - BAD REQUEST: The request could not be understood by the server 
            due to malformed syntax                    
> 401 - UNAUTHORIZED: The supplied credentials, if any, are not sufficient 
            to access the resource
> 404 - NOT FOUND: The server has not found anything matching the 
            Request-URI
> 429 - TOO MANY REQUESTS: Your application is sending too many 
            simultaneous requests
> 500 - SERVER ERROR: We couldn't return the representation due to 
            an internal server error
> 503 - SERVICE UNAVAILABLE: We are temporarily unable to return 
            the representation. Please wait for a bit and try again.

```

tags.name: PAGINATION
tags.description:
Pagination can be implemented with the query parameter `page`, which accepts two parameters.
The first parameter represents which page is returned (starting from index = 0).
The second parameter represents how many records each page contains and, therefore, the number of records that will be returned. **Examples:** |URL | Records returned| |---------------------------------------------------|-----------------| |https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/34/data/cgn?page=0,5 | returns the 5 records of page index 0 (records 1 -> 5) | |https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/34/data/cgn?page=1,5 | returns the 5 records of page index 1 (records 6 -> 10) | |https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/34/data/cgn?page=1,8 | returns the 8 records of page index 1 (records 9 -> 16) | |https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/34/data/cgn?page=2,6 | returns the 6 records of page index 2 (records 13 -> 18) |

tags.name: BUSINESS UNITS
tags.description: Business Units are much like Client Groups except that a Business Units is managed by a Business Units Admin who has access similar to that of a Super Admin. These are often used if a company has multiple locations under which clients exist (e.g. franchises). As a Business Unit Admin you can manage a single Business Unit or a Group of Business Units.

tags.name: CHANNELS
tags.description: A way to bring in metrics from multiple data sources and show the performance of your campaign across these data sources.

tags.name: CLIENT'S CATEGORIES
tags.description: Refers to the categories that be assigned to a Client (For example: Services, Automotive, Retailer, Restaurant...).

tags.name: CLIENT GROUPS
tags.description: Client Groups allow you to group Clients together. This way you can grant an agent access to all of their reports. These groups can be used with Clients who have multiple locations that require individual reporting, but also require one person to have complete data access. You can also create groups of Client groups if the need is there.

tags.name: DATA PROFILES
tags.description: Data Profiles help you control the types of campaigns, data and metric you want each User to have access to.

tags.name: DATA TYPES
tags.description: All data types available for any field.

tags.name: DATE RANGE
tags.description: Date ranges allow you to focus on the data set you are concerned about or want to run a report for.

tags.name: LEADS
tags.description: Only if the Leads Management module is active.

tags.name: ROLES
tags.description: Roles are used to control the access of Agents and Business Unit Admins. If the TapOrders module is active, IOTool roles can be assigned to “Super Admin”, “Agent” and “Business Unit Admin” type of user as well.

tags.name: SERVICES (DATA SOURCES)
tags.description: Services are the Data Sources that a client can connect to pull data into TapClicks; these also include all the resources that were created with the Smart Connector.

tags.name: EXAMPLES
tags.description: | Replace the the {id} in the URL with a service_id from the list of all Services (Data Sources) | | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | **1. Get API version** | | https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/ | | **2. Get metadata for the service** | | https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/services/{id}/data/cgn?metadata=1 | | **3. Get services level data** | | https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/services/{id} | | **4. Get campaign level data** | | https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/services/{id}/data/cgn | | **5. Get campaign level data paginated** | | https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/services/{id}/data/cgn?page=0,10 | | **6. Get campaign level data paginated and grouped yearly** | | https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/services/{id}/data/cgn?page=0,10&timegrouping=yearly | | **7. Get certain metrics only** | | https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/services/{id}/data/cgn?page=0,10&groupby=customer_id&fields=customer_id,CTR,AverageCPC,ClickCount&sort=customer_id |

get.description: This call will simply return a "Welcome to TAP API" message

Clusters are Business Units. This returns a specific Business Unit (*cluster_id*).

**Note:** if the path parameter *cluster_id* is omitted, this will return all the Business Units in the instance (in the response, the "data" field will be an array of cluster objects).

parameters.name: /cluster_id
parameters.description: Numeric Id of the cluster to get. If omitted, it will return all Business Units.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: The API will provide more or all the info for the available fields.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The example will return the first five records. Please refer to Pagination for more examples. This will limit the number of rows in the fetch result.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
This will filter the result data with the specific fields.

**Note:** when using this query parameter, other than the ones specified, more fields may be returned as well.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Ascending by default; prefix **-** for descending.

This will alphabetically sort the results by name.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The API will provide a total number of records in the result.

parameters.name: field_data_filter
parameters.description:
This will filter the data that contains only specific values. To remove items use **!** before the value. Example: `"https://api.tapclicks.com/v2/clusters?id=!12"`
This will return all clusters, except for the one with id = 12

post.description: Clusters are Business Units. This edits an existing Business Unit.

parameters.name: /cluster_id
parameters.description: Numeric Id of the cluster to edit.

delete.description: Clusters are Business Units. This deletes a new Business Unit.

parameters.name: /cluster_id
parameters.description: Numeric Id of the cluster to delete.

post.description: Clusters are Business Units. This creates a new Business Unit.

parameters.description: The results will be grouped based on the provided field

parameters.description: The results will be grouped and narrowed within the specified timegroup

parameters.description: The results will be the aggregated value of each field

parameters.name: row_grouping_count
parameters.description: Passing **row_grouping_count** along with the list of **fields** will provide grouped result and row count on each group (**groupby**)

parameters.name: nested
parameters.description: Fetch grouped data that nested based on the groupby expression

parameters.name: daterange
parameters.description:
The example will return the leads with a timestamp for the month of December.

This filters the result between the given date range (YYYY-MM-DD).

get.description: This returns the data for a specific service. This API call should utilize as many query parameters as needed to obtain the specific data available for a certain data view. Please refer to the Examples section for more specific use cases. **Note:** the fields listed in the response example may differ depending on the service (data-source) the user is trying to pull the data from.

parameters.name: /id
parameters.description: Id of the service to get

parameters.name: /data_view_id
parameters.description: Data view id the column belongs to

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: The API will provide more or all the info for the available fields.

parameters.description: The example will return the first five records. Please refer to Pagination for more examples. This will limit the number of rows in the fetch result.

**Note:** when using this query parameter, other than the ones specified, more fields may be returned as well.

parameters.description:
Ascending by default; prefix **-** for descending.

This will alphabetically sort the results by Customer name.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The API will provide a total number of records in the result.

parameters.name: field_data_filter
parameters.description:
This will filter the data that contains only specific values. To remove items use **!** before the value. Example: `"http://api.tapclicks.com/v2/services/34/data/cgn?fields=client_name,ClickCount,ImpressionCount&&customer_id=!921"`
This will return the selected fields from all Customers, except for the customer id = 921

parameters.name: groupby

parameters.description: Fetch grouped data that nested based on the groupby expression

parameters.name: daterange
parameters.description:
The example will return clicks and impressions with a timestamp for the month of December.

This filters the result between the given date range (YYYY-MM-DD).

**Note:** if the path parameter *id* is omitted, this will return a list of all the information of all services (in the response, the "data" field will be an array of infoService objects).

parameters.description: Id of the service to get. If omitted, it will return all the information of all the services

data.summary: AdGear Technologies, Inc. is a digital advertising technology company, providing software and services for the digital media industry. The company's full-stack advertising platform offers customers advanced advertising analytics, attribution measurement, ad serving, real-time bidding and exchange technology. AdGear
